meanings.definition: A person who takes a position of power or importance illegally or by force.
meanings.sent1: The usurper claimed the throne without any right.
meanings.sent2: The kingdom was in chaos after the arrival of the usurper.
meanings.sent3: The usurper tried to sneak into the king's chair during the play.
meanings.sent4: The usurper of the company's CEO position was finally exposed.
meanings.sent5: The usurper's greed knew no bounds as he plotted to overthrow the rightful ruler.

meanings.definition: To seize and hold (a position, office, power, etc.) by force or without legal right.
meanings.sent1: The rebels attempted to usurp the government but failed.
meanings.sent2: The dictator managed to usurp control of the entire country.
meanings.sent3: The students jokingly planned to usurp the teacher's desk during lunch.
meanings.sent4: The new technology quickly usurped the old methods in the industry.
meanings.sent5: The ambitious villain sought to usurp the superhero's powers for himself.
